title: Claudio Ranieri says Jamie Vardy's Champions League lifeline can be a turning point in Foxes' faltering season
text:

Claudio Ranieri insists Leicester's wretched domestic season is about to improve after Jamie Vardy's gave them a Champions League lifeline. 
The England striker scored his first goal in 10 games with a 73rd minute effort to halve Sevilla's lead after the hosts dominated. 
Vardy dedicated his goal to his newborn son Finley, who arrived last month. 
Under-pressure boss Ranieri hopes the brave comeback, after Kasper Schmeichel saved a penalty and Sevilla hit the woodwork, can spark a revival. 
After five successive Premier League losses without scoring, the champions are just two points off the bottom ahead of Liverpool's visit on Monday. Vardy slotting home Drinkwater's cross... (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) ... and celebrated by dedicating the goal to his baby son (Photo: Getty Images) 
Ranieri said: “It could be a turning point but it is important to make another good match against Liverpool. 
“It gives strength to us, Vardy goes back to the goals and it re-opens the match in the second leg. 
“I think we are still the underdogs. 
“We know they are better than us but we have a big heart. 
“I think this result can give us a help. 
“The goal scorer needs to score, needs to get confidence. Vardy's men have been slipping towards the relegation zone (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More 
“We fight everytime but this time a little more. 
“When you give everything also the luck comes to you.” 
The two-legged contest could have been over had Schmeichel not produced a man of the match display. 
His heroics included keeping out Joaquin Correa's early penalty. 
Pablo Sarabia eventually broke the deadlock in the 25th minute with a fine header. 
Correa got on the scoresheet himself in the 62nd minute with a clinical fight-foot finish. 
But Vardy converted Danny Drinkwater's brilliant cross late on. The Foxes must overcome a 2-1 first-leg deficit back at the King Power (Photo: Getty) Read More Sevilla 2-1 Leicester player ratings 
It was just one of only two shots on target from the visitors as Sevilla hit the post and bar and enjoyed 70% possession. 
Vardy marked his goal by sucking his thumb, he said: “The celebration was for Finley, he's probably asleep but that was for him.” 
The England striker's wife also Tweeted: “Guess that's what happens when you get 'service'.” 
Schmeichel said: “On reflection, 2-1 away in the champions league is a good result. 
“The away goal is massive going back to King Power anything can happen, its a joy to play in these type of games, everyone ran their socks off. 
“That's what I'm there to do when you have nights like that, we knew we'd have to ride our luck and come up with some saves but everyone deserves credit. We've lost the game, we aren't celebrating, but we'll take it.” poll loading Are champions Leicester going down? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
